properties.Incident d: Whilst at anchor, four to five pirates from an unlit craft boarded the ship. The pirates jumped overboard empty handed
properties.Action tak: An anti-piracy watch was maintained, the team raised the alarm and awakened the crew

properties.Incident d: A number of armed men in a fast boat tried to stop ship at sea by firing on it
properties.Action tak: Master took evasive action by using helm movements

properties.Incident d: Bandits armed with swords and knives boarded the ship and stole spare parts from the engine room. The thieves used a small boat to gain access to the ship. While two remained aboard their "getaway" boat, six other robbers boarded the ship and used heavy
properties.Action tak: Attempts by the crew to approach the thieves were not successful

properties.Incident d: About 25 shots fired at ship before being boarded by about 35 uniformed men from a naval-type craft
properties.Action tak: Crew surrendered to the boarding party

properties.Incident d: Ship chased by high speed craft. Seven people tried to board the ship
properties.Action tak: Crew avoided the craft by manoeuvring action

properties.Incident d: Ship chased by high speed craft which unsuccessfully tried to put men on board
properties.Action tak: Crew succeeded in repulsing the craft by firing parachute rockets

properties.Incident d: On passage from Singapore to Ho Chi Minh, unlit craft sighted approaching from astern at high speed
properties.Action tak: General alarm sounded, accommodation doors secured, crew assembled on bridge, craft plotted on radar. Suspect craft departed by 05:00

properties.Incident d: Ship whilst on passage thwarted three attempts by pirates to board
properties.Action tak: Emergency alarm sounded,crew mobilized

properties.Incident d: Ship successfully frustrated attempt at boarding from a fast boat
properties.Action tak: Master avoided craft by increasing speed

properties.Incident d: A gang of about 10 men boarded ship while at anchor and stole 10 mooring ropes and various items of ship's stores
properties.Action tak: Harbour master and local agent informed

properties.Incident d: While underway, a pirate boat was spotted about five miles away. It converged and attempted to board, but the vessel zig-zagged, blew its whistle, flashed its Aldis lamp and alerted lookouts on deck. The pirate boat fled
properties.Action tak: The vessel maintained a strict anti-piracy watch

properties.Incident d: 30 pirates armed with machine guns and pistols machine gunned cabin doors when crew did not come out. Crew were handcuffed and locked up for two days. On 15 September the vessel stopped in position 8ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½20' N - 107ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ 14' E
properties.Action tak: On 16th September, 15 crew members were rescued by a Vietnamese fishing boat and taken into Vung Tau City and on the following day it was reported that the remaining members of the crew had also been rescued by a fishing vessel and taken into Vung Tau Ci

properties.Incident d: At 03:00 hrs pirates were seen approaching in 3 modern speed boats in which there was sort of a machine gun. 2nd Mate was informed through walkie talkie and the alarm bell was sounded. Master and all crew on deck
properties.Action tak: As the pirates saw the searching party, they immediately escaped in their speed boats

properties.Incident d: The watchman discovered fifteen pirates on the poopdeck and two boats alongside the stern. He gave the alarm and the pirates escaped in their boats
properties.Action tak: The Master called Chittagong Port Radio Control

properties.Incident d: As movement was sighted forward, the deck watch sent to investigate. Five persons were found lowering ship's mooring ropes into a boat alongside. The alarm was raised and the boarders jumped into the sea and escaped. At 03:20, four persons boarded the sh
properties.Action tak: Watches strengthened

properties.Incident d: Five pirates armed with guns attacked the ship and broke six containers, stealing computer spare parts. After twenty minutes, the pirates left the ship
properties.Action tak: The Master reported the incident to the Harbour Master

properties.Incident d: Seven pirates climbed using the anchor cable and attempted to steal mooring ropes. They were noticed first by Hong Kong Marine Patrol who chased and apprehended the pirates
properties.Action tak: Assistance to Hong Kong Marine Police in their investigation

properties.Incident d: Seven pirates, carrying knives and guns, boarded the ship
properties.Action tak: The Master sounded the emergency alarm. Inside accommodation and all watertigth doors were locked

properties.Incident d: AB'S of watch on deck saw five/six boats with pirates who came alongside the ship. Some pirates managed to climb on board by means of lines fitted with hooks
properties.Action tak: Ship's crew managed to push the pirates away

properties.Incident d: Two speed boats, light green, two people in each boat with masks on their faces, came toward the ship, very close, and slowed down to ship's speed
properties.Action tak: The crew was alerted and waved them away with threatening motions

properties.Incident d: Four pirates boarded the ship at the stern. The Master sounded the alarm, increased speed and changed course erratically. Pirates then headed off towards Anambas Island
properties.Action tak: The Master sounded the alarm

properties.Incident d: About fifteen pirates armed with old rifles shot about 10-12 times
properties.Action tak: Crew sounded the alarm and requested assistance from a large Malaysian tanker

properties.Incident d: Ten or so pirates boarded the ship with a motorized canoe
properties.Action tak: Crew raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Pirates boarded the ship and tried to open the doors on the Captain's deck
properties.Action tak: Crew raised the alarm and maintained anti-piracy watches

properties.Incident d: Four/five pirates were spotted by the crew on duty but they had already stolen one mooring rope, which they discharged into their boat and disappeared
properties.Action tak: Watches increased on deck, all ship's lights switched on

properties.Incident d: Six pirates in three speed boats attempted to board the ship but failed because of the Captain's manoeuvres
properties.Action tak: Captain manoeuvred the ship in zigzag to prevent pirates from boarding

properties.Incident d: Pirates attempted to board the ship using a false distress message. Ship avoided signalling boat and sailed away
properties.Action tak: Ship sailed away

properties.Incident d: One pirate armed with a long knife attempted to board the ship via the anchor cable.  The pirate left the ship when spotted by the crew.  Three other pirates were waiting in a small boat
properties.Action tak: Crew sounded the alarm

properties.Incident d: Pirates in a speed boat followed the ship and attempted to board her
properties.Action tak: Master increased the speed to avoid boarding

properties.Incident d: A number of armed pirates boarded the ship
properties.Action tak: Wounded people were taken to the hospital

properties.Incident d: While underway, pirates in a boat fired at the ship
properties.Action tak: Master refused to stop and sailed away

properties.Incident d: Two speed boats approached the ship and fired at her with automatic weapons. They attempted to board the ship but left 25 minutes later
properties.Action tak: Ship did not stop

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, two pirates boarded the ship but alert crew foiled the attack
properties.Action tak: Crew foiled the attack

properties.Action tak: Duty watchman raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: While underway, a lookout spotted a craft coming from stern. Crew unsure as to whether the pirates managed to board the ship
properties.Action tak: Crew raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Ten pirates approached the ship in a speed boat. Three of them tried to board the ship but were repelled by the crew and disappeared
properties.Action tak: Crew foiled the attack

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, pirates boarded the ship but were chased away by the crew
properties.Action tak: Crew chased away the pirates and apprehended one of them who was handed over to the authorities

properties.Incident d: While underway, four wooden boats approached the ship and one metal hull boat came close to navigation firing at the bridge with shotgun
properties.Action tak: Advised all ships in the vicinity to be cautious

properties.Incident d: While underway, a speed boat approached the ship and about 6 to 8 pirates were seen climbing onboard
properties.Action tak: Crew raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Pirates boarded the ship using a bamboo hook which is still available on board
properties.Action tak: Master informed other ships on the road

properties.Incident d: While underway, a pirate boat approached the ship. The boat moved away when the crew shined the Aldis light
properties.Action tak: Crew switched on the Aldis light

properties.Action tak: The Master increased the speed of the ship to its maximum to clear away from the pirate boats and ordered all the crew to remain in sheltered places to avoid any injuries

properties.Incident d: Crew noticed suspicious movements at the forecastle, while underway in fishing grounds with many boats around. When the flood lights were switched on, two armed robbers jumped into a small boat and fled at high speed with four others
properties.Action tak: Crew alerted and made rounds at the forecastle

properties.Incident d: Five armed pirates in two boats attempted to board the ship, while underway
properties.Action tak: Alert crew spotted the boats and raised the alarm which prevented boarding

properties.Incident d: While underway, pirates in a craft attempted to board the ship. Alert crew foiled the boarding
properties.Action tak: Alert crew foiled boarding - raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Seven pirates in two small white open speed boats armed with machine guns and rockets fired upon a ship whilst underway. The ship took evasive action and cleared the area. No serious damage to ship or injuries to crew
properties.Action tak: NA

properties.Action tak: Nil

properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and mustered crew

properties.Action tak: Alarm raised

properties.Action tak: Raised alarm, mustered crew and ship altered course

properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and mustered crew

properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and mustered crew

properties.Action tak: Raised alarm, altered course and increased speed

properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and mustered crew
